question: Whether it was that first meal, the music, or the 100 years of rest, I'm not sure, but suddenly I was feeling better than ever. My appetite for living was voracious. My hearing so exact I could locate precisely the source of the music... My old house. It was hard to believe these beings were mortal -- so confident in their skin. Everything in my body wanted to be with them. I couldn't help myself. Please don't stop. The door, of course. Your music woke me from the longest sleep. It's sublime. In two hundred years I've never heard anything quite like it. The question provoked an irresistible urge... You may call me the vampire Lestat. It just rolled out of my mouth. With one simple sentence I had betrayed everything about my kind. Betrayed our code of secrecy. Your struggles are over. All that you've ever dreamed of will be yours. Your lucky day. It was a bold move, I admit. But from that moment on, they were my friends, my children, my band. Together we rode on the wave of my preternatural ambition to superstardom, giving the world a new god... me.
answer: May I present the Vampire Lestat.

question: Good evening. I'm so sorry I'm late. I was just having my... breakfast.
answer: Hey, hey! We're gonna keep this short here! One at a time. You!

question: Yes. But why hide it in this day and age? I've hidden in the shadows for centuries. It's time to share myself with the world.
answer: And it doesn't hurt the record sales, huh? Your album just topped all kinds of sales records.

question: Our label isn't complaining, no. If you like, I'll give you a private demonstration in your hotel room tonight. After calling one stone tomb home sweet home for so long, I like to experience as much diversity as I can. Wouldn't you?
answer: There are a lot of rumors flying around the internet about the hidden meaning in your lyrics, that you're giving away 'vampire secrets.' Something in all that?

question: Maybe I'm trying to resurrect a few old friends with my words. Daring them to come out.
answer: Of the closet.

question: The casket...
answer: Your first and only concert's in Death Valley, just days away. Why just the one?

question: I don't like repeating myself.
answer: But these other vampires, aren't they going to be pissed that you're giving away their secrets?

question: But... uh...
answer: Wait a second. Who took this picture?

question: I did.
answer: You went there?

question: Yes. Last night.
answer: And who gave you this directive?

question: No one. I... just... went. Look, I know it was breaking protocol and I'm really sorry, it's just I think --
answer: Jesse! You're just an apprentice here! You must follow our rules... Or perhaps we need to reconsider your position.

question: Vampires. Gathering. I'm sure of it. You have to listen to Lestat's lyrics. They're amazing. Many of the references could only be derived from years of research in the Bibliotech de Paris, which seems unlikely for a young rock star in his early twenties. Plus there are historical details dating back hundreds of years Lestat describes that don't exist anywhere... except in our library. He refers to Marius, the great white lord, who ruled over a group of islands off the Bay of Naples in the late 18th Century. What I'm trying to say here, and maybe I'm not doing the best job of it, is that Lestat may be the oldest and most powerful vampire ever documented!
answer: It doesn't make any sense. Why would he be forecasting this to the world? He's all but drawn a map and marked an X. What vampires hold sacred is keeping their kind a secret. You never name other immortals, tell where their lairs are. They'd be hunted down.

question: Right. That's the best part. Lestat's not afraid to piss them off. He wants mortals and immortals to know he's there, to know he exists. I don't know why... But this has never happened before. Don't you see? He's a one man revolution.
answer: And this photo is your evidence? It's hardly conclusive. C'mon. It looks like the Blair witch!

question: How's everything? You alright? You sleeping okay?
answer: Yeah, I'm great. I just found a vampire.

question: Jesse... you're taking this Lestat stuff pretty seriously... why?
answer: Cause I think I'm on to something pretty big. The most important sighting Talamasca's had in years... Jesus, I don't know, David... I thought I was onto something... Maybe I didn't see anything...

question: You know we work in a really strange field? The supernatural is beguiling at times. It doesn't like to just be observed, it is only satisfied when it has drawn us in completely. I know cause I've felt these things myself. That's what we have to resist, as Talamascans... It's not always easy.
answer: Talbot. C'mon. You know me. I'm not freaking out on you. I'm just onto what looks -- alright looked David. There's nothing else. Nothing is 'beguiling' me, alright? Nothing. C'mon.

question: Alright. Just checking... Well, all I can say is you're really lucky you're not lying dead in a gutter with two holes on your neck.
answer: I'd be even luckier if that damn picture came out... Wait a second. So you do believe me? You do think it's a vampire coven.

question: Yes. But not exactly for the reasons you think. Though your research is top-notch of course... Come back here. I'm gonna show you something. What do you see?
answer: They're all nightscapes. The detail is amazing. Mid-1500s. Florence.

question: Right. And what do you see in this one? And I know it's a Dutch pastoral.
answer: This man is in both.

question: Right. He's in all of them.
answer: Have you --

question: Carbon tested? Yes. The different paint samples are all authentic. All painted at the time of that particular style. It's Marius, Jesse.
answer: Marius?! From Lestat's lyrics. I knew I was right.

question: Yes, you were. Good work. I've been personally tracing him for decades. My little obsession. The oldest vampire ever documented. The closest we've come to the original vampire.
answer: What do you mean the original vampire?

question: There's a Mesopotamian legend that there once was a queen of Egypt, Akasha, long before Tutankhamen or Nefertiti. She was believed to be the original vampire... Marius himself dates back to 400 B.C...
answer: David, you've been tracking Marius your whole life. Maybe he's out there waiting for you right now. Don't you ever want to just go and find him and --

question: No. Jesus, we are not talking about having a drink at the Dorchester, Jesse. You know that. Especially with the ancient vampires -- the older they are, the more powerful, the more dangerous... Anyway, you don't need to go and stake out some club. Your time is too valuable. I have something far better for you...
answer: You do?

question: Yes. And I'll tell you something. I've never shown this to anyone. No one else has proved themself in the way you have.
answer: Thanks. What is it?

question: Oh you're gonna love this. Although I'm sure it will keep you up nights to come with nightmares... Lestat's diary. I found it some years ago. This is where you'll find the answers you need. They don't need to know everything, right?
answer: Thank you for this.

question: My pleasure. When I took you on as an apprentice, I knew it was the smartest thing I'd ever done. Now you and I'll meet when you're done... This will be our project...
answer: Je suis le vampire Lestat... I am the vampire Lestat.

question: It was the winter of 1788 and I was brought to a Mediterranean Island by the man who made me... ... if a man is what you'd call him.
answer: Lestat. Welcome.

question: Who are you? Do I know you?
answer: I'm unknowable by nature. But you may call me Marius.

question: I'm the lord of a great manor. They'll send an army of men to look for me.
answer: I doubt they'll find you, Lord De Lioncourt. You're a long way from home... You're weak... near passing. I can barely hear your heartbeat.

question: I'll kill you!
answer: You really do fear nothing. It is why I chose you. Because you think things are possible which aren't possible...

question: Chose me? For what?
answer: My companion. Someone to share my burden. You've lost a great deal of blood.

question: I'm dying.
answer: Then drink. Good, is it not? Drink and live. You've been brave enough for one night, my son. Drink... drink and learn. There... there... that will do. No... no more. Lestat, no more! Don't be afraid, it's only your body that dies...

question: More! I impressed my maker with my thirst for things. He set out to educate me in the unknown. Taught me all about the world, its hidden history... and about myself.
answer: That's enough, my son... When you feed, you must hold back from the moment of death. You must never take the last drop, or it will draw you in and you will die... Remember, there is wisdom in the flesh, Lestat. A man wears his history on his skin... I'm talking about humanity.

question: Humanity? We're murderers.
answer: We're more than that. Their blood that we take into us carries with it life... their life, their knowledge, their complexity. Appreciate your prey, Lestat.

question: My senses run amok, like a newborn child. And as for my new powers, I was beside myself with the pleasure of it all...
answer: The trick is to find the way to face eternity head on. The spirit can be annihilated by boredom just as the body can be destroyed by sun or fire. My solace, my delight, is witnessing the unfolding of human destiny... ... From Christ to the Dark Ages to the enlightenment, I've never been able to divine what was coming. That's what keeps me going -- I can't wait to see what human beings are going to do next... Who could've predicted the Enlightenment? Or Hannibal and his elephants? Careful.

question: But why must we hide, Marius? We are the powerful, we are the immortal. We should walk fearless in the open!
answer: Shhh. The life of a vampire is a life of discretion. We must sleep during the day, when we are vulnerable to the sun. Mortals must never know about us. It is forbidden, for the sake of all our kind.

question: So I could never know her?
answer: Not unless you wanted to kill her.

question: So I can never be known?
answer: You're known by me. I granted you that. There are others of our kind... though most are solitary creatures.

question: My God...
answer: Forget God. You're no longer in his realm. Now we must leave. Stop her, Lestat! You must! I will not have you put everything at risk! You will mind our laws! We remain in the shadows. To do otherwise is a road to destruction... I see you still have a few lingering mortal emotions. They will serve you no good, Lestat.

question: Every coven's going...
answer: Sure, all the time.

question: Don't see any marks.
answer: You haven't seen the rest of my body. My host... oh he's here somewhere. Marius...

question: Sorry. Don't know the guy.
answer: Marius has the blood of the ancients flowing in his veins. That's a myth. Marius is around here somewhere... You... you really should meet him.

question: And why is that?
answer: Because... because... he's wise, a philosopher... he asks the big questions. Like how are you going to get through eternity? It's easier for us mortals. Life is brief, but for you... I mean... what can you really do with immortality besides just slip from one day to the next, trapped in a void of meaninglessness, relieved only by your next victim? How do you not give in to despair and just wither away from boredom, hopelessness? You know, it's like they say -- the more things change, the more they stay the same. For you that's forever, right?

question: You know, you're really a downer...
answer: You saved me.

question: You saved me.
answer: Perhaps... So you know Marius...

question: I know a lot of things.
answer: Not how to stay alive apparently.

question: Well I guess we've got that in common. Although I think I'm a little ahead in the race here.
answer: Well, I can fix that.

question: 'Mine eyes dazzle, she died so young.' It's about the girl with the violin, isn't it?
answer: Is it? And what else do you think you know?

question: I... I think you're a lot like Marius, Lestat.
answer: Am I? Tell me all about it.

question: You're... you're both artists. He's a painter. You're a singer...
answer: Is that so? What I do is art, is it?

question: Yes... From nothing... you try to create... something beautiful... ... out of the... the cold, dark wasteland of eternity...
answer: Something beautiful...

question: But... but Marius isn't a rebel. You're different in that way. You don't want to hide, follow the laws, concealed in the shadows like some insect. You... you still want to walk with the living, don't you, Lestat?
answer: Well, I'm not hiding now, am I?

question: No, but the only time you're not really alone is when you kill... But, Lestat, you can't help it... it's not your fault... He made you this way...
answer: Ah. Poor, poor me... Well, Talamascan, you're certainly a very clever librarian, aren't you? How sad, you people always trying to know the unknowable... So, was it a good read? My diary. Talamasca's been following me for years. I've never known one to be so brave. Or is it just foolish?

question: I... I'm only an apprentice.
answer: Go. I'm through with you. Your kind never satisfies my thirst.

question: Does anything, Lestat? I mean, what's the point of coming into the light if not to have someone really know you? You want the world to see you're real, don't you, Lestat? Don't you? Well, here I am!
answer: You better just stick to your books, Talamascan. 'Cause you have it all wrong. I love all this. I delight in it. The dark, dreary world I went to sleep in has burnt itself out and been replaced by the 20th Century -- can you imagine my joy at waking up to discover such a world? It has outdistanced my wildest dreams of it. I scream of good and evil, and mortals stand and cheer. I adore being back in action... every moment, every single drop of it! Now consider yourself exceedingly lucky and go!

question: Lestat! There's something you left out of your diary.
answer: What?

question: I heard that Lestat keeps all these girls in all his wine cellars, and it's really nice, and they give you food and cable and weed.
answer: Oh, please...

question: That's what I heard. But you have to let him suck you on your neck whenever he wants. Doesn't sound too bad.
answer: We've done worse.

question: Damn straight... Hey, do you remember that cute guy's name at the Kid Rock concert? The one behind the bathroom.
answer: Oh yeah. Let me think... his first name was Blow. And his second name was Me, I think.

question: Clever, clever librarian.
answer: I didn't see you come in.

question: No, Roger, you wouldn't have.
answer: So this house is fine I assume. To your liking?

question: Yes. For the moment.
answer: We'll be here for what? A week you think?

question: Well... I wouldn't unpack if I were you.
answer: Right... the... girls you asked for. They're in the guest wing.

question: Ah. Yes.
answer: Do you want me to take them home later?

question: Of course you do.
answer: Want some? Want me? You hungry?

question: I'm always hungry.
answer: We've got the munchies? You got any food?

question: Vampires don't eat... food.
answer: You hungry for something else?

question: Mine eyes dazzle, she died so young.
answer: Huh?

question: It's a very old poem of mine.
answer: C'mon, don't you want to have some fun?

question: Don't do that.
answer: Are you ticklish?

question: You're right, David. The journal has everything in it.
answer: I knew you'd appreciate its scientific significance.

question: David, listen... I'm going to Los Angeles for the concert.
answer: What? You are not! I forbid it.

question: David, I... I talked to him... Look I'm sorry. But I... I have to see what's out there with my own eyes. I'm onto something. I just don't know what yet... I have to find out...
answer: Jesse, you listen to me very, very carefully now. You are no longer seeing things clearly. Your emotions are clouding things.

question: It's not emotion. It's instinct... I'll return when I have my findings. Good-bye.
answer: Jesse, wait!

question: Yes, Marius was impressed with my thirst for knowledge... But it Marius! They're... alive. Would you like me to play for you?
answer: What have you done, Lestat? Lestat! Lestat?

question: More!
answer: I don't think so, my little lord.

question: Let me go!
answer: No. You've drunk the purest blood. Seen the oldest of things -- far too much for one as young as you. You've been unconscious for days.

question: God, her blood is like liquid fire. Who are they?
answer: She... she is your mother, my mother... Akasha, the Queen of all who are damned. And he is her King.

question: Release me!
answer: She made you quite powerful. Don't make me use this!

question: Marius, please, just one more time. I felt the sun. The light, Marius, the light!
answer: Lestat, listen to me! I have watched over Akasha and her King for 2000 years! They must never awaken! Akasha and her King nearly drank this earth dry when they ruled over Egypt. They drank until they lost their will to drink. They became living statues. And yet Akasha still sustains the life force of all vampires. It is believed what happens to her, happens to all of us. If she were ever to rise, she would again desiccate the earth! She has no respect for anything except the taste of blood. Immortal and human alike...

question: You'll not stop me...
answer: I hear her blood in your voice... In all the years I've cared for them, not once have they moved...

question: Until tonight. And she chose me! Me! Never you! You'll not stop me!
answer: You are part of a great coven! You take responsibility for your kind!

question: I must have more!
answer: I chose you for your bravery, but I was wrong. You know only selfishness. I can no longer trust you... It gives me no pleasure to look upon what I have created.

question: I hate bedtime. Marius...!
answer: Lestat. It is good to see you, Lestat.

question: And you. Still wearing the old fashions, I see.
answer: Old habits die hard.

question: How did you manage to slip through the 1950s in red velvet?
answer: I slept.

question: Don't think you missed much.
answer: Elvis.

question: Elvis, yes.
answer: You're bigger than he is now.

question: I'd say a few pounds lighter. Though, if you ever catch me wearing a white jumpsuit, you have my permission to slice off my head.
answer: If someone doesn't get to you first.

question: Live and let live.
answer: If it were only so simple, my son.

question: How did you find me?
answer: You forget. We ancients have powers no ordinary vampires possess... And I know you. I remembered how you admired the medieval fortresses in the hilltowns of Lyon. All you're missing is the moat and the cannons... which you may need.

question: Come, let me show you what it means to live in the light.
answer: Impressive. Reminds me of mad old Druids running around chanting in the forest. Very primitive stuff.

question: Out there. My fans. Thousands and thousands. They worship me. Millions of arms reach out to embrace, beg me to come into their lives.
answer: It's what you've always wanted.

question: With all my black little heart.
answer: Do you think of anyone but yourself?

question: I only have myself.
answer: It may be time to get ready for some company.

question: What's that supposed to mean?
answer: Your music's woken a very old friend... Can't you hear it? Or is the applause all you can hear now? Akasha has risen. She has taken her King's blood. Absorbed his power. You've done it this time.

question: Good! I'm glad she's risen! Let her come.
answer: Don't you understand? You must stop this concert!

question: 200 years and the same broken record.
answer: No. Not the same! You've only known Akasha dormant. She too will find you. She is choosing her moment. She has come to destroy you, Lestat. And in her wrath, she will devour everything that moves. Mortal and vampire alike.

question: Well then, it's every vampire for himself. Just the kind of rules I like. The rules you taught me. Do you remember your first words to me, Marius? 'I am unknowable.' I'd rather not exist at all than have to live eternally as a ghost.
answer: And you're taking everyone with you, you fool! We were once mortals, too. It is our heritage we protect!

question: Such reverence for mortals! Then you should have left me as one!
answer: You're a monster.

question: The... girls you asked for, Lestat. They're here, in the guest wing.
answer: Ah. Yes.

question: I was uh... just gonna go catch a movie at the Chinese. I don't suppose you'd all want to...
answer: No, thank you, Roger. We'll entertain ourselves. Perhaps you would like a tour of the place... first. Roger... would you be so kind?

question: Sure. Right this way, girls.
answer: Roger. Not that one. Leave her to me... You must be very keen to die. The Talamascans have become quite stealthy. I didn't know infiltration was quite their style.

question: Roger. Not that one. Leave her to me... You must be very keen to die. The Talamascans have become quite stealthy. I didn't know infiltration was quite their style.
answer: It's not. I... I came on my own.

question: How did you find me?
answer: I've been tracking your manager for days... Then I figured out you simply have to look the part.

question: Clever librarian... You should know, based on all your research, that groupies don't ever find their way out of here again.
answer: I'm not a groupie...

question: Then why are you following me? What do you want?
answer: Are you granting wishes?

question: Last wishes. What's yours?
answer: Show me what it's like to be you. That's my last wish. Grant it, Lestat.

question: I don't have time for this.
answer: All a vampire has is time.

question: Maybe not.
answer: Right. The covens are coming for you. I understand why you're doing it. You have to be who you are, no matter what happens. But how are you spending what may be your last night on Earth, Lestat? As you always have... Alone. Don't kill me yet. Let's spend our last nights together. Share it with me. Show me what it's like to be you.

question: You don't know what you're asking! I don't know what's in that librarian's head of yours, but it's not what you think.
answer: That's right. You don't know what's in my head, Lestat. Do you want to?

question: I'll know when I kill you.
answer: Gee, Lestat, that's a great way to get to know someone. Here. I'll give you a preview. Coming attractions. This is what you'll find. I have this recurring dream that I'm a child and I'm living in this big house filled with vampires. And every night when I go to sleep, I wish to God the same thing... you know what that is, Lestat? That I will have the dream again... Because in the dream I'm happy. And the dream is more real than my life... I don't know how, but I know you, Lestat... My life is a big mystery and you, you have the answer... I can't go on pretending this life of mine is real. I can't live a lie... I'm just like you Lestat. We're the same...

question: Are we? I seek the light. You seek the shadows.
answer: No. We're looking for exactly the same thing. You know it... Please. Show me.

question: Alright! This may be painful for a mortal. You're still attached to your skin.
answer: I don't care.

question: Close your eyes. Don't breathe.
answer: Do that again!

question: And now for my next trick.
answer: Did it hurt?

question: Yes. For just a moment. But as the pain is more intense for us, so is ecstacy. You see, we love our victims.
answer: Love? I thought it was the blood.

question: No, although the taste is so rich and sweet. Love is the essence of the dark gift. The connection is so much more satisfying, brief as it is, than anything else. As you drink, you feel the heart weakening... it struggles even though there's no hope. You feel the life slipping away, the flash of those brief years. The taste of mortality you can no longer experience... and it is beautiful... No 'relationship,' no commingling can ever reach the heights of that experience. Your blood...
answer: Do you like it?

question: Yes...
answer: Do it to me... Please... With your blood I'll know you... I'll know everything...

question: You want to know everything. You want to see what it's like. Then come! I'll show you.
answer: Is she alright?

question: Come closer, Jesse. You want to see? You want to know?
answer: Lestat, no!

question: You see now? Are you ready? Now do you want it?! No. Of course you don't. Well I didn't grant your final wish. It was an impossible wish to begin with. You see, I am unknowable.
answer: Lestat! Wait!

question: I don't want you to go, but you must. You must be with your own, my sweetest girl. I'll always be watching over you. Forever is a very long time. Hello, my princess.
answer: Aunt Maharet? You're a...?

question: Yes. Oh, Jesse, I've missed you so much, but I had to keep this from you.
answer: Oh my God, this is why... I knew I was different. I knew --

question: Come... You are the most precious of my great family...
answer: Am I...?

question: No. You are not. I was once mortal, too. My sister died before her child was one year old. I took care of that child, and her children, and her children's children... This is our family -- my way of coping with eternity. The labyrinth of life. The family teaches me the rhythms and passions of each age. You are my most prized light. You are what keeps me connected to the world of the living. When your parents died I took you to India to take care of you.
answer: And something happened there.

question: I stopped it from happening. And I will again. Jesse, you must stay away from Lestat. You must forget all about him. Yes, I know about your new friend. You think you love him, but it's not as you thought it would be.
answer: I thought I was like him.

question: I know, but it is not who you are, not who you are meant to be. You have found that out now.
answer: Lestat's all I can think about... I felt like I belonged with him. Now I know why...

question: Jesse, you must forget about him. You must trust me...
answer: I missed you so much, Aunt Maharet.

question: Me too. You will go home to London in the morning.
answer: But this is my home. This is where I belong. Why do you want to get rid of me so quickly?

question: Akasha...
answer: Why so surprised, my love? You called, and I have come. Never fear me, Lestat. Your wishes have all come true.

question: My wishes...?
answer: You have yearned for a companion to share eternity. You have cried out to the world. I have answered your call. You are so bold, like your music. It woke me. You live your life in the open, like I did long ago, when I had a King.

question: Had a King?
answer: He's no more. You are my consort. I've kept you safe -- alive.

question: You?
answer: You thought it was all you? You have the ego of a king as well. I know you, Lestat. I know that you crave to have the world at your feet. I have come to give it to you. Has your tongue lost its taste for blood?

question: Never.
answer: But you didn't kill the mortal girl. Instead you kissed her. Now kiss me. Be my King. Forget about everything else. What's your answer?

question: Where are we?
answer: We are home.

question: You live here?
answer: We live everywhere and anywhere we choose. The world is our garden.

question: So warm... ... their blood...
... they're mortal...
answer: ... of course. They serve the living goddess, and her consort. They find you beautiful. You are a god in their eyes. Behold our Kingdom.

question: Why?
answer: Why not?

question: This is the reason you have risen?
answer: They believed in nothing, now they are nothing. But you and I will change all that. We will give the world something to believe in again. Come, my King. We have a score to settle.

question: I want to hear it from every one of you. What will it be? Don't tell me, you have feelings for these ridiculous mortals! Do you love me?
answer: Yes...

question: Prove it. Kill her.
answer: She's nothing to me.

question: Just the same, I'd like you to kill her. For me. I've had enough of this 'great family.' It's time to end it.
answer: You will not touch her!

question: You still think to challenge me, Maharet?
answer: I beg you, spare this child.

question: Strangely, no...
answer: Please don't be sad. I'm where I belong. I'm happy now.

question: Excuse me for asking but...
answer: What's it like?

question: Yes.
answer: Do you want to find out?

question: Me?... No. I'm too old to live forever.
answer: Well, if you ever should change your mind... Oh. I have a present for you. From an old friend. And Marius sent a message. You were right. He doesn't go to the Dorchester. But he's gonna be at Claridge's later... Well, I guess this is good-bye.
